bash:run.description: Run a command in the current directory or select multiple directories

list.name: list
list.description: List all projects to run the command.

args.name: command
args.description: Define the command to run [38;5;149mgit add . && git push[39m

git:clone.description: (Only for git users) Clone the passed repositories

args.name: repositoryUrl
args.description: Pass the base repository name url

args.name: repositoryList
args.description: Pass the list of repositories to be released, this list must be separated by commas

git:init.description: (Only for git users) Add base files for manage the documentation and versioning in the  git repository

list.name: list
list.description: List all projects to select to setup.

git:release.description: (Only for git users) Bumps the app version, commits, and pushes to remote the app in the current directory.

no-deploy.name: no-deploy
no-deploy.description: Automatic run preRelease script from the manifest file.

no-check-release.name: no-check-release
no-check-release.description: Automatic check if the release is valid and not have local changes.

vtex:login.description: Command to make login in VTEX, this command use the api key and api token to get the auth token and save in the config file of vtex to allow the process to use the vtex cli

args.name: account
args.description: Define the account to set in the config file

args.name: email
args.description: Define the user email to set in the config file

args.name: workspace
args.description: Define the workspace to use in the process

args.name: apiKey
args.description: Pass your api key to use in the process

args.name: apiToken
args.description: Pass your api token to use in the process

vtex:run.description: Run a command and accept the ask question by default with yes "y"
examples: [38;5;205mprojex vtex run[39m 'vtex release minor stable' or [38;5;205mprojex vtex run[39m 'git status'

args.name: command
args.description: Define the command to run [38;5;149mvtex release minor stable[39m, when you use this command we detect any message with the question "Yes/Not" and we response "y" automatically or if the command finish with errors whe finish with a Throw error to finish all process

git:setup:husky.description: (Only for git users) Add the husky setup to the selected repositories

list.name: list
list.description: List all projects to select to setup husky.

vtex:cms:backup.description: Download the files from the checkout files of vtex

args.name: site
args.description: Define the account location to use, for default use [38;5;149mdefault[39m account of vtex, this is used when the account have multiple sub hosts

vtex:cms:deploy.description: Deploy a local files in the checkout of the current account

args.name: extension
args.description: Define the account location to use, for default use [38;5;149mdefault[39m account of vtex, this is used when the account have multiple sub hosts

args.name: site
args.description: Define the account location to use, for default use [38;5;149mdefault[39m account of vtex, this is used when the account have multiple sub hosts

git:setup:devops:template.description: Add the .azuredevops folder and create the PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md file

list.name: list
list.description: List all projects to select to setup the template.
